titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas and Coahuila Land Grants
Wagner (Henry Raup) Collection of Texas and Coahuila Land Grants
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 07:21
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Henry Raup Wagner collection of Texas and Coahuila land grants

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Petitions for land grants in Coahuila and Texas and supporting documentation.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas and Coahuila Land Grants is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas and Coahuila Land Grants. Yale Collection of Western American, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Other portions of Wagner's Texas manuscripts collection have been cataloged separately. They include papers of Jean Louis Berlandier and Philip Nolan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Henry Raup Wagner Collection of Texas and Coahuila Land Grants, contains petitions for land grants in Texas from the period 1829-31, including supporting documents and official endorsements from the period showing the disposition of the petitions. Many of the petitions are accompanied by testimony from Stephen F. Austin. The documents are arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Petition to land commissioner, Bexar, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 9 p. 31 cm. Accompanied by testimony of J.A. Padilla, grant by Gov. Viesca, and appointment of Francisco Madero as land commissioner by Governor Letona.
